errorMessage.minProperties: A browser must be described within the file.
errorMessage.maxProperties: Each browser JSON file may only describe one browser.

name.description: The browser brand name (e.g. Firefox, Firefox Android, Chrome, etc.).

type.description: The platform the browser runs on (e.g. desktop, mobile, XR, or server engine).

upstream.description: The upstream browser this browser derives from (e.g. Firefox Android is derived from Firefox, Edge is derived from Chrome).

preview_name.description: The name of the browser's preview channel (e.g. 'Nightly' for Firefox or 'TP' for Safari).

pref_url.description: URL of the page where feature flags can be changed (e.g. 'about:config' for Firefox or 'chrome://flags' for Chrome).

accepts_flags.description: Whether the browser supports user-toggleable flags that enable or disable features.

releases.description: The known versions of this browser.

release_date.description: The date on which this version was released, formatted as `YYYY-MM-DD`.

release_notes.description: A link to the release notes or changelog for a given release.

status.description: A property indicating where in the lifetime cycle this release is in (e.g. current, retired, beta, nightly).

engine.description: Name of the browser's underlying engine.

engine_version.description: Version of the engine corresponding to the browser version.
